# Weights

.pull-left3[

<ul>
  <li class="m1"><span><high>Project the input</high> to the next/final layer, similar to a regression.</span></li>
  <li class="m2"><span>Typically initialized with small <high>random values</high>.</span></li>
</ul>

]

.pull-right6[

<p align = "right">
<img src="image/perceptron_5.png" height=380px><br>
</p>

]


---

# Output

.pull-left3[

<ul>
  <li class="m1"><span>A <high>linear combination</high> of the projecting inputs and their weights passed thorough an <high>step activation</high> function.</span></li>
</ul>

<p style="padding-top:20px"><u>Ouptut activation</u></p>

$$\begin{align*}  a^L &= \sigma(w^\intercal a^{L-1}) \\ & =\sigma(w_1 \cdot a^{L-1}_1 + \cdots + w_j \cdot a^{L-1}_j) \\ & =\sigma(w_1 \cdot x_1+ \cdots + w_j \cdot x_j) \end{align*}$$


<p style="padding-top:20px"><u>Step activation function</u></p>

$$\sigma(z) = {\begin{cases}{}
        0, & \text{for } z \leq 0 \\
        1, & \text{for } z > 0 \end{cases}}$$

]

.pull-right6[

<p align = "right">
<img src="image/perceptron_6.png" height=380px><br>
</p>

]


---

# Loss

.pull-left3[

<ul>
  <li class="m1"><span>The loss summarizes the <high>mismatch between the output activation and the criterion</high>.</span></li><br>
  <li class="m2"><span>The loss is used as a <high>means to update the weights</high>.</span></li>
</ul>

$$L_i(w_t) = y_i - w_t^\intercal x_i$$

]

.pull-right6[

<p align = "right">
<img src="image/perceptron_7.png" height=380px><br>
</p>

]


---

# Update

.pull-left3[

<ul>
  <li class="m1"><span>A given weight is updated proportional to the loss, the input that is projected by the weight, and a learning rate <mono>r</mono>.</span></li><br>
</ul>

<p style="padding-top:20px"><u>Weight updating</u></p>

$$\large w_{t+1} = w_t + r \cdot L_i \cdot x_{ji}$$

]

.pull-right6[

<p align = "right">
<img src="image/perceptron_8.png" height=380px><br>
</p>

]
